When encrypting a database, the primary objective is to protect the data from unauthorized viewing. Encryption uses algorithms to transform data into an unreadable format, making it difficult for unauthorized individuals to access or decipher the information. By encrypting a database, even if someone gains unauthorized access to the data, they will not be able to understand or interpret the encrypted content without the decryption key. This helps to safeguard sensitive and confidential information and maintain data privacy and security.

Audit observations should be FIRST communicated with the auditee:

discussion.content:
During fieldwork, auditors may communicate preliminary observations or issues as they arise to facilitate immediate action or clarification. However, the formal communication of all audit observations, including any additional insights gained throughout the audit process, typically occurs at the end of fieldwork. This ensures that the auditee receives a comprehensive overview of the audit findings before finalizing the audit report.
Answer will be B

Selected Answer: A
Communicating audit findings at the end of fieldwork is also not ideal. It may not allow sufficient time for the auditor and auditee to discuss and agree on findings and recommendations.

A. during fieldwork.

During fieldwork, auditors should communicate their observations to the auditee as they are identified. This allows for timely discussion, clarification, and resolution of issues, ensuring that corrective actions can be taken promptly if needed. Waiting until the end of fieldwork or until the audit report is drafted may delay addressing important issues and could potentially hinder the effectiveness of the audit process. Therefore, it is best practice to communicate audit observations to the auditee as they arise during fieldwork.

Tabletop exercises are simulations to check response plans and procedures in the event of a disaster or failure, and to ensure that relevant parties are prepared in advance. If the time required for the exercise is longer than the RTO, there may not be enough time to restore systems and services as planned in the event of an actual disaster. This has a significant impact on the reliability and effectiveness of the business continuity plan.
